question: Does this only work in Cursor?
answer: No. The Weaviate Agent Skill follows the Agent Skills format, so it can be used with Claude Code, Cursor, Cloud Code, or any compatible agent runtime.

question: Do I need MCP to use this?
answer: Not necessarily. MCP can be useful, but weâ€™re also exploring lighter workflows like the Weaviate CLI and improving docs navigation so agents can reference code patterns more easily.

question: Do cookbooks include a frontend?
answer: Cookbooks focus on the core Weaviate implementation (e.g. ingest, chunk, embed, query). Frontends are intentionally kept separate so prompts stay concise and easy to customize.

question: Where do prompts live?
answer: Prompts are centralized in weaviate-prompts so they can be reused across docs, cloud console, agent skills, and cookbooks.

question: Can an agent delete my data?
answer: Destructive operations (delete/wipe) are intentionally not exposed by default. Some advanced actions may require explicit human approval depending on the workflow.
